bug.short_desc: The pages are stoped by "leugostats.com" and don't open.

assigned_to.name: Nobody; OK to take it and work on it

long_desc.thetext:
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; pt-BR; rv:1.9.2.16) Gecko/20110319 Firefox/3.6.16 ( .NET CLR 3.5.30729) Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; pt-BR; rv:1.9.2.16) Gecko/20110319 Firefox/3.6.16 ( .NET CLR 3.5.30729)
When I choose a site to open, before ins the status bar show the name "leu gostats" and the browser find the page, but it don't open. I use others browsers and this don't happen. Thanks
Reproducible: Always

Tamir, does this happen with a specific site, or does it happen with all sites? Please give us a link to a site where it happens.
I guess "leugostats.com" is Portuguese and means Reading GoStats (a hit counter).
Does this happen in Safe-Mode too? https://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Safe+Mode
You may also test with a clean profile: https://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Basic%20Troubleshooting#w_8-make-a-new-profile
And since you are still running Firefox 3.6.16, although still supported, you may consider upgrading to Firefox 4: https://www.mozilla.com/en-US/firefox/all.html

$ nslookup leugostats.com 8.8.8.8 Server: 8.8.8.8 Address: 8.8.8.8#53
** server can't find leugostats.com: NXDOMAIN
